fields.description:
After having a look at the sexy new membership management - it's a huge improvement on the old system - there's a few things that need some tidying up before we can ship.

There are three marked-up screens attached. The issues are:

* Whitespace is too large between section header (user members or group members) and the actual members.
* When the add/remove dialog opens, the result header should not be visible. Gives the impression that there are no users to add. Instead there should be text to help the user understand they should search for the users they want to add.
* When you have added/removed users from a group, there's no visual feedback of success. There should be text on the lines of "Users successfully added. Continue adding or close."
* The "Remove" link is obsolete. Having two ways to remove a user is pointless. Remove it :-)
* Group member adding should be through a similar dialog mechanism to user adding. 
* The "Update" button does nothing. Lets get rid of it.
* "Add Selected Users" should not be clickable if no users are selected :-)
fields.summary: UI Improvements for Group Membership Management
Search by Alias and other User attributes
XML Migration for Alias Information
Alias Object Model + Hibenate DAO
Implementation of the AliasService/Manager
Test Crowd on All Supported Databases

fields.description:
When adding a user with an email adress like "test.T@company.com" I get a "The supplied email address is invalid" error

after changing it to "test.t@company.com" emailaddress was accepted.
fields.summary: a single Capital in a email address after a dot is not accepted

fields.description: Our LDAP queries need to take into account roles when they are enabled.
fields.summary: Add Role selection to LDAP queries and updates

fields.description: Before importing from XML we need to validate that there are no clashes between Groups and Roles, since there is a uniqueness contraint on name/directoryid for Groups (Role is now a Group Type)
fields.summary: On import check for any Group & Role name clashes

fields.description:
I would suggest writing a generic validator interface and register a list of validator's against a directory.

Validator's can be responsible for checking and reporting an error for a directory on request.
fields.summary: Configuration Errors need to be displayed for an LDAP directory if Roles are enabled and the DN's for both Groups and Roles overlap.

fields.description:
The RemoteDirectory now supports a much more advanced searching API. Currently this new API is not exposed to clients so no one can take advantage of these improvements.

This should also incorporate the ability to rename users where the directory supports it.
fields.summary: Create a new Security Server API for Crowd that exposes the improvements made to the underlying Remote Directory API.

fields.description:
This is a parent holder issue for Crowd's improved database schema, which will better support *all* our supported databases. 

We will also try and improve the performance of the Internal Directory.
fields.summary: Crowd Schema + Domain Model update to improve performance and cross-database compliance

fields.description: Test Crowd on Windows Vista and make sure its native IPV6 can be disabled.
fields.summary: Test Crowd on Windows Vista

fields.description:
The *Import Users* feature does not perform a complete import when using MySQL.

mysql-connector-java-3.1.14

fields.summary: User/Group/Membership Import fails when using MySQL

fields.description:
I am having a problem with SVN crowd integration.  Our crowd instance is licensed to Paige Dunham at Emory University.

I have a single repository with several directories. Each directory represents a development project. Each directory has subdirectories trunk, tags, and branches.

I have set up SVN with crowd integration and for the most part things work as expected. Each project has its own crowd group.

The issue I am running into is that when I try to create a tag within a project, as a member of the project's crowd group, I get the PROPFIND 403 authz failed error trying to access /svn. The project's crowd group does not have access to /svn but has rw access to the project directory /svn/projectX. I am not sure why the authorization for tagging is based on /svn instead of /svn/projectX or /svn/projectX/tags.  If I give the project's crowd group write access to /svn, then things work obviously, which is a non-ideal solution as it defeats the purpose of svn access control at all.

Below are my httpd.conf and my svn authz files.  These are created based on the Crowd-Subversion integration documentation. 

httpd.conf:

   1. Needed to do Subversion Apache server.

LoadModule dav_svn_module modules/mod_dav_svn.so

   1. Only needed if you decide to do "per-directory" access control.

LoadModule authz_svn_module modules/mod_authz_svn.so

   1. required by crowd, but already loaded

#LoadModule perl_module modules/mod_perl.so

   1. for crowd integration. crowd does not support SVNParentPath

<Location /svn>
DAV svn
SVNPath /data/svn/cci

AuthName "Subversion Crowd"
AuthType Basic

SSLRequireSSL

# do not use crowd for auth for now.
PerlAuthenHandler Apache::CrowdAuth
PerlSetVar CrowdAppName subversion
PerlSetVar CrowdAppPassword passwd
PerlSetVar CrowdSOAPURL https://hostname/crowd/services/SecurityServ
er

# do not use crowd for authz for now
PerlAccessHandler Apache::CrowdAuthz->access_handler
PerlAuthzHandler Apache::CrowdAuthz
PerlSetVar CrowdAuthzSVNAccessFile /data/svn/dav_svn_crowd.authz
Satisfy any
Require valid-user

# set caching to on to improve performance.
PerlSetVar CrowdCacheEnabled on
PerlSetVar CrowdCacheLocation /tmp/CrowdAuth
PerlSetVar CrowdCacheExpiry 300

</Location>

and the dav_svn_crowd.authz file:

   1. only svn-admin can modify at the root level (e.g. create new directories)

[/]
@svn-admin = rw

   1. xmldata service

[/xservice]
@svn-xservice = rw

    * = r


   1. cvrg

[/cvrg]
@svn-cvrg = rw

    * = r


   1. incubator

[/incubator]
@svn-incubator = rw

    * = r


   1. ivi

[/ivi]
@svn-ivi = rw

    * = r


#permissions
[/permissions]
@svn-permissions = rw

    * = r


Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: svn with crowd integration - unable to create subproject tag in svn without repo root directory write access

fields.description:
Installation Wizard last step "fails" and Crowd work again only if Tomcat is restarted.

So, looks like the installation is complete and correct, however, Crowd is unresponsive after that.

fields.summary: Add specific error messages for SMTP Server errors
Search in the Validation Factors list fails when a NULL validation factor is sent by an Applicattion Connector
Bamboo and Crowde Caches still not playing nicely

fields.description: In the Crowd console, searches (users, groups, roles) are submitted as a POST. This means I cannot reload the search without a browser warning, and cannot give the URL to someone else to try as it doesn't capture the full state.
fields.summary: Crowd console searches should be GET, not POST

fields.description:
In the Crowd Directory Browser screen, each directory has a linked name, and a 'View' link:

!crowd_directories.png!

For a Crowd Internal Directory, the name and view link goes to the same config screen.

For LDAP directories, the view link goes to the same config screen. 

For Delegated directories, the view link goes to a *different* screen (viewcustom.action instead of viewdelegated.action) that displays an "Attributes" tab, full of vital information.

This is rather confusing and inconsistent.
fields.summary: Delegated directory attributes only accessible via 'view' link, not by clicking on directory name

fields.description: When searching for a user or a group or a role, the "Active" dropdown list allows you to select "All", "Active" or "In-Active". Please can we change "In-Active" to "Inactive" here and anywhere else where it may occur.
fields.summary: Change text "In-Active" to "Inactive" in dropdown lists for user and group status

fields.description:
It is currently difficult to determine if invalid authentication requests are coming from applications like Confluence when "Remember Me" is checked.  

For example, if a user changes their Crowd password, then they open a browser with multiple tabs to Confuence, it will register multiple invalid password attempts.

All that is logged in Crowd Debug logging is:

{code}
 DEBUG [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] authenticate: user dyu
 DEBUG [crowd.model.principal.PrincipalDAOHibernate] Updating Principal: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemotePrincipal@17bf658[ID=-1,name=dyu,directoryID=98306,active=true,conception=2009-02-20 16:08:33.0,lastModified=2009-04-09 08:15:22.0]
 DEBUG [util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao] Updating object: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemotePrincipal@17bf658[ID=-1,name=dyu,directoryID=98306,active=true,conception=2009-02-20 16:08:33.0,lastModified=2009-04-09 08:15:22.0]
 DEBUG [crowd.console.filter.CrowdOpenSessionInViewFilter] Closing single Hibernate Session in OpenSessionInViewFilter
{code}

There is no indication that the login failed.  This can cause supportability issues if they have Maximum Password Attempts enabled.  An account can become locked and it would be difficult to determine why.
fields.summary: Improve logging for Invalid authenticate requests from apps that utilize seraph cookies

fields.description: After a restore from xml, when login page is displayed the SSO Domain error is also displayed (even though SSO Domain is set correctly)
fields.summary: Restoring from backup displays 'SSO Domain' error message on login page

fields.description: Fix up the search/filtering to get a non-member list for GroupUserPicker and RoleUserPicker.
fields.summary: Search Filtering for non-members for Group and Role UserPicker

fields.description:
For a {{findAllGroupRelationships}} call, if you have multiple directories with the same group across directories OR if you have a group with the same name that appears multiple times in your group subtree scope:
- the first instance of the group will correctly have the _group_ members (subgroups) amalgamated to the results (correct behaviour)
- any subsequent instance of the group will have the _principal_ members amalgamated to the results (incorrect behaviour)

For very large user bases with very large duplicated groups, this can manifest itself as a significant performance issue.

The fix will involve patching the amalgamation code in {{ApplicationServiceGeneric.searchGroups()}} on the 1.6 branch. This issue is not present on the 2.0 branch as searching has been completely revamped.
fields.summary: Performance issue when amalgamating groups for a findAllGroupRelationships call

fields.description:
When a Confluence plugin searches for {{null}} users, Confluence returns nothing. If that Confluence instance is connected to Crowd, the Crowd {{atlassian-user}} integration interprets that as a search for all users, and returns that large list.

Related issue in CSUM Plugin that discovered the issue: [http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/SUSR-93].
fields.summary: Confluence search for "null" returns all users; behaviour differs from non-Crowdified Confluence

fields.description: com.atlassian.crowd.console.filter.CrowdGzipFilterIntegration.useGzip appears to call back to the database every time to check if it is enabled or not
fields.summary: com.atlassian.crowd.console.filter.CrowdGzipFilterIntegration.useGzip hits database on every invocation

fields.description:
Crowd has two delegated authentication LDAP directories configured. These are copies of each other and have the same user data and credentials.
JIRA is configured to use Crowd for authentication and authorisation. Crowd defines both directories to be used for authentication for JIRA.
Shutting down the primary directory stops also JIRA authentication. Crowd should be enhanced to support fail-over to the secondary directory.
This enables users easily to use Crowd for improving availablity of authentication with several instances of the same authentication data.
fields.summary: Fail-over to secodary delegated authentication LDAP directory

fields.description:
* Claims will cache forever by default in all versions.  This appears to not be the case in 2.2.1; at least not deliberately.
* Claims you need to add 'bamboo-administrator' group; this is should be bamboo-admin
fields.summary: Misc problems in Crowd/Bamboo docs
Update SAL to 2.0 to enable REST interfaces

fields.description:
User and group amalgamation will not work until we have a domain model for the ApplicationService and higher that is not directory aware (ie. no directory ID on the entity).

WARNING: THIS MUST BE FIXED BEFORE WE RELEASE 2.0 - DIRECTORY AMALGAMATION IS BROKEN
fields.summary: Amalgamation is broken thanks to equals/hashcode using directoryId on directory entities - maybe we need application entities

fields.description:
If an application is assigned to two directories {{d1}} and {{d2}} and a user with name {{A}} exists in both then it should be expected that the user returned the application on a {{findUserByName}} call will have the attributes of user {{A}} in {{d1}} and {{A}} in {{d2}} combined.

Perhaps this should only extend to custom attributes and the primary attributes should be obtained from the first directory that contains the user in the ordered list of directories associated with the application.
fields.summary: Amalgamation operation of users with same name across multiple directories should amalgamate attribute values

fields.description:
Consider the case where an application is assigned to two directories {{d1}} and {{d2}} and they have the following nested groups:
- {{d1}} : {{B}} member of {{A}}
- {{d2}} : {{C}} member of {{B}}

The question is: is {{C}} a nested member of {{A}}?

Currently:
- if you use the {{CachingGroupMembershipManager}}, all the group relationships are first downloaded from the server and amalgamated, and then the nesting is resolved locally on the client causing {{C}} to be a member of {{B}} and then {{B}} to be a member of {{A}}.
- if you use the {{ApplicationServiceGeneric}}, the group relationships are calculated incrementally per directory and the final results are amalgamated causing {{C}} be a member of {{B}} only.

This behaviour is highly inconsistent as it implies that using caching on the client will produce different results to making queries directly to the server.
fields.summary: Client/Server nested groups resolution behaves inconsistently

fields.description: To give more redundancy it would be good if Crowd could be aware of the existance of multiple replicated LDAP servers to retry against.  Additionally, it would be useful to be able to specify a timeout for connections before trying the next server.
fields.summary: Allow multiple LDAP backends to be specified, with connection timeout

fields.description:
Implement Directory Caching Support for OpenLDAP.

(The same feature implemented for AD and ApacheDS at CWD-1346)
fields.summary: Implement server-side remote directory caching for OpenLDAP

fields.description: Every time I've gone to create a new connector in 1.6.1, I've checked the checkbox to use nested groups.  However, when I click the Continue button, and it takes me back to the Details screen, if I click back onto the Connector tab, it shows Nested Groups as unchecked.  If I then check it again, and click on Update, it will accept it and keep it.
fields.summary: when creating a new connector, nested groups checkbox doesn't stay checked

fields.description:
I accidentally misconfigured my ApacheDS connector (update information, forgot include the password field, so it submitted it as blank), and now every time I go to a page that touches that connector, I have to wait 10 minutes for the page to load while it times out the connection, and then gives the following messages in the error log:
2009-03-26 11:43:47,241 http-8095-Processor22 WARN [directory.monitor.listener.ApacheDSPersistentSearchListener] Unable to remove PrincipalChangeListener for directory with ID: 2031617
2009-03-26 11:46:56,170 http-8095-Processor22 WARN [directory.monitor.listener.ApacheDSPersistentSearchListener] Unable to remove GroupChangeListener for directory with ID: 2031617
2009-03-26 11:50:05,098 http-8095-Processor22 WARN [directory.monitor.listener.ApacheDSPersistentSearchListener] Unable to remove RoleChangeListener for directory with ID: 2031617

Notice that those are 3-4 minutes apart each, plus the timeout before that that took several minutes to process.
fields.summary: UI hang when ApacheDS connector is misconfigured
Upgrade Crowd to atlassian-core 4.2
Upgrade Crowd to Plugins 2.2.0.rc2

fields.description:
This will first demand a investigation about which threads are created by Crowd and which are created by the frameworks.

When possible (also for the frameworks), add a unique name to each of them
fields.summary: Add a *unique name* to each Crowd thread so that they can be easily identified at Thread Dumps
Implement a PluginPersistentStateStore for Crowd that isn't an in-memory one. This will need to be database backed.

fields.description: Allow Crowd to detect that a Proxy is being used and Log it in the log file and/or display an error on the console UI
fields.summary: Allow the Crowd admin to know when a proxy should be added to the Trusted Proxy list

fields.description:
Currently, Crowd displays on the UI the exact error message retrieved by the LDAP server.

Crowd should display the error code meaning and interpret the message.
fields.summary: Interpret LDAP error codes for console users

fields.description:
Improve *Node Referrals* feature description and display an alert messages when the feature should be enabled.

Currently, error messages related to "Object not Found" are displayed and the referrals errors are in the log files only.
fields.summary: Improve *Node Referrals* feature description and display an alert messages when the feature should be enabled.

fields.description:
Currently the Crowd documentation on configuring the client-side caching explains how to set up the cache. What it doesn't explain is how to determine what the values should be.

We need some examples and maybe a troubleshooting guide.
fields.summary: Add examples & best practices to Crowd caching documentation

fields.description: if it doesn't, a java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Would be nice if a clearer error message was thrown.
fields.summary: ClientPropertiesImpl.generateBaseURL() assumes that server URL contains /services

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a user with an email address of the form user@hyphenated-host.com.
2) Click the Reset Password link for the user.
3) Click the Confirm button to generate a random password and email it to the user.

An error message will be displayed stating that the email address is invalid.  See the attached image.  Note that the actual email address was obscured by me intentionally.

We support a number of users with this sort of email address since some of our domains are hyphenated.  The only workaround for now is to manually change the password and then manually email the new password to the user.  This is both less secure and less convenient.
fields.summary: Unable to reset the password for a user with an email address of the form user@hyphenated-host.com
Re-enable by-email search tests when new schema lands on trunk

fields.description:
User aliases need to be managable via a remote API.

This remote API should, at a minimum, allow:

# Query for all aliases of a user.
# Find the user with a given alias for a specific application
# Turning a user in directoryA into an alias of a user in directoryB. _This is to allow 'claiming' of accounts._
fields.summary: Remote API for managing user aliasing

fields.description:
Application alias information should be shown in three places:

* When it matches a search term in the user browser. See CWD-1467 for extra work here.
* On the details of a user.
* On a user's profile page.

Wrinkles:
* What happens where there are large numbers of aliases? What if user X has 100+ application aliases? What if they're all the same (ie, there's only {{jsmith}} and {{jon}}, but {{jon}} is for 100 apps)? What if they're all different?
fields.summary: Add alias information to user UI

fields.description:
We need to 'boost' the visibility of aliases for a specific application when the admin searches in the context of the app's Users tab.

Some ideas:
* Only search for aliases where application = 'myapp'
* Only show the alias for application = 'myapp'
* Show alias for application = 'myapp' in another font/color.
fields.summary: Highlight application-specific alias when searching in the context of that application

fields.description:
Currently renameUser and renameGroup will throw UnsupportedOperationExceptions.

It would be nice to implement these on the SpringLDAPConnector and also cater for:
- remote monitoring of rename events
- cache update operations to support object renaming
fields.summary: Support renaming of users from LDAP directories in Crowd

fields.description: Placeholder issue to ensure we don't forget to link to-be-written documentation back to the UI screen.
fields.summary: Documentation link for new Users screen in Application and other help links

fields.description: Display the JVM locale on the System Info page
fields.summary: Display the JVM locale on the System Info page

fields.description:
Since CWD-1390 is fixed, users should not be able to set invalid SSO Domain values. 

So in the Domain page, the first bullet point under *Notes* in the docs _"If you have set the SSO domain to an invalid value, you may be prevented from logging in to the Crowd Console.You can reset the SSO domain through the database."_ can be removed.

As Dave said  _That way we don't scare people about stuff that's no longer a problem_ :)
fields.summary: Remove "If you have set the SSO Domain..." bullet point

fields.description:
When identifying the user/group members of a group, the user/group filter and subtree scope are not applied to the members. They are simply retrieved by their DN/UID and their objectClass attribute determines whether they are a user member or a group member.

Similarly, if the memberOf field is used to determine the group memberships of a user, the group filter and group subtree scope are not applied.

The result is that more memberships/members are displayed because the extra filter/subtree restrictions are not applied.
fields.summary: Group/User memberships do not obey the tree scope or object filters

fields.description: Added red crosses to improve UI for removing group in Add Application Wizard (see CWD-1373)
fields.summary: Added crosses for removing group in Add Application Wizard

fields.description: The fix will be to use an actual DML call to execute the deletion of expired tokens as opposed to loading them all into memory and removing the expired tokens one-by-one.
fields.summary: Removing expired tokens from the database token repository requires all tokens to be loaded into memory

fields.description: Crowd Client making multiple requests to SecurityServer.findAllGroupRelationships() cause Crowd's http queue to overflow
fields.summary: Crowd Client making multiple requests to SecurityServer.findAllGroupRelationships() cause Crowd's http queue to overflow

fields.description: It's great how you can change the log levels for a handful of loggers, but how about enabling this for any logger? Obvious one that comes to mind is Hibernate SQL logging.
fields.summary: Add ability to change log levels for other loggers

fields.description: I couldn't find an issue for this already, which surprises me.
fields.summary: Why isn't there a CachingAuthenticationManager?

fields.description: For consistency...

Convert Crowd from XHTML strict to HTML4 strict

fields.description: When a user attempts to change their password to one used previously, Crowd displays "You do not have permission to change your password" instead of a more appropriate error message.
fields.summary: Bad Error Messages.

fields.description: New "Test Connection" and "Test Search" buttons added for Directory pages as per CWD-1180 and CWD-919
fields.summary: Test buttons for directory pages

fields.description:
In the User Browser, you can only delete one user at a time. Every user needs three mouse clicks to romeve.
It would be a huge improvement to have selection checkboxes, and a select all/none possibility to select users and then a 'remove selected'-button to remove the selected users.
fields.summary: Allow bulk user  deletes in User Browser

fields.description: As the current formulation of roles will be deprecated in Crowd 2.0, it is best to disable roles by default and allow users to explicitly define a role sub-tree if they require it.
fields.summary: Disable roles by default on newly created LDAP directories for 2.0

fields.description:
For groups that contain over 1500 members AD returns the members in an attribute named *member;range=0-1499*, expecting the receiving application (Crowd) to do paging on the attribute values. Crowd does not recognize this attribute name, as it is expecting to find attributes called member. Because of this, group memberships cannot be resolved from the group side for large groups. The workaround for this issue is to use the Use the User Membership Attribute option. 

The following are the consequences:
1-) To be able to use Crowd caching, the *Use the User Membership Attribute* must be enabled.
2-) Currently the LDAP caching supports groups with a maximum of 1499 users memberships.

The workarounds would be to:
1-) Disable caching (if using this workaround, to avoid performance issues, be sure the application side cache will timeout during out of peak hours or our of working hours).
2-) Create many directories and using filters, make sure they will have less than 1499 users each. This would allow to continue using LDAP caching.
fields.summary: Support *range* attribute for Active Directory

fields.description:
Currently, when a login tentative to a integrated application fails, Crowd doesn't log any error message.

For security reasons, it should log the username and possibly, the details of the machine (eg. IP address)
fields.summary: Log failed login tentatives for integrated applications.
Upgrade Crowd to Plugins 2.2.0

fields.description:
The license count is based on the group membership, not in the real number of users that can be fetched from a Directory.

How to reproduce:

1-) Have Crowd integrated to an LDAP server
2-) Create an Application and add to it some _can login_ groups
3-) Go to the Licensing page and Recalculate the number of users.
4-) Go to the LDAP connector Configuration tab and add a filter to exclude one of the users that are members of the _can login_ groups (ex: *(!(cn=username))* ).
5-) List the users using Crowd console. User *username* will not be listed.
6-) List the groups using Crowd console. Click {{view}} for the _can login_ groups and check the members. User *username* will be listed!
7-) Go to the Licensing page and Recalculate the number of users. The number of users will be the same as the one calculated in item 3, since the users are counted checking the group memberships.
fields.summary: Wrong license user count when users still members of an application group

fields.description: Currently, Crowd Apache integration doesn't support SSO.
fields.summary: Support SSO for Apache Integration

fields.description: Per CWD-1438, the documentation for JIVE integration doesn't mention that you'll have to update the version of the XFire libraries shipped with JIVE Forums.
fields.summary: Document the fact that JIVE Forums integration requires updating the XFire libraries to 1.2.6

When I try and integrate with 1.6.1's (and 1.5.2's and 1.4.7's which I downloaded to test) integration suite I get this error:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.service.soap.client.CleaningHttpMessageSender.getClient()Lorg/apache/commons/httpclient/HttpClient;
	com.atlassian.crowd.integration.service.soap.client.CleaningHttpMessageSender.close(CleaningHttpMessageSender.java:37)

The only one I could get to work was 1.3.2 (I am still using Crowd 1.6.1, but using the integration tools for 1.3.2).  I also tried multiple versions of JIVE from 5.5.13 (which is listed as working in the Crowd documentation) and 5.5.24.  However I have had to disable the group management from JIVE, because when I try to bring it up with it enabled, I get this error:
java.lang.AbstractMethodError: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.jive.CrowdGroupManager.getGroupIDs(Lcom/jivesoftware/base/User;)Lcom/jivesoftware/util/LongList;

Now despite what you may think, JIVE may not be selling new copies of their forums software, but they ARE still developing/fixing it for those who still have it - the 5.5.24 version was released on Jan 19th, 2009 and I have no intention of going to their horrendous ClearSpace (it looks ugly, duplicates functionality I already have and doesn't have a lot of the features I LIKE about Jive, things like synchronization between forums and NNTP).  So please don't just close this because JIVE has disappeared of jivesoftware.com's product page.
fields.summary: Crowd integration past 1.3.2 does not work with JIVE Forums

fields.description:
When adding a new user to a Crowd directory it would be useful to send username and password information to the new user so that he can login and change his password.
The documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Adding+a+User says "If you have configured an email server and a notification template, Crowd will send the user an email notification about their new password.". However, this feature does not work (exist?) in Crowd 1.6.
fields.summary: Send email with username and password when new user is added

fields.description:
i've integrated jira with crowd. authentication and permissions work.

then a user serf-registered on crowd and used his email address as username. the user was correctly created in crowd and he could login.


but after that i can no longer login into crowd! login in applications works properly. only crowd does not allow login. there is no stackstrace in the logs (even in debug mode). using a non-existent username showed the correct error message. using correct username/password showed no error but the login page again.

i also tried deleting all cookies. but it would not go away.

after i imported an older version of the database (without that user) login into crowd worked again!


there are only two weird messages in the logs (see attached file). but they do not relate to the behaviour considering the time of the exceptions.
fields.summary: self registered users with email address as username break crowd login

fields.description:
It appears relayStateURL needs to be HTML encoded in the SAMLAuthResponse.

Otherwise, in IE7, you'd get the following URL where the "<" symbol causes a Bad Request error.

https://www.google.com/a/test.atlassian.comServiceLogin?service=mail&passive=true&rm=false&continue=http%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fa%2Ftest.atlassian.com%2F&bsv=1k1643f4806cy<mpl=default<mplcache=2

Firefox doesn't display this error because it automatically encodes URLs.
fields.summary: Google Apps SSO with Crowd results in Bad Request Error during authentication for IE7

fields.description: Currently, you can look in the database or backup file and see the user name and password for the SMTP server in clear text. The other passwords in the database are all stored in SHA1. You should do this also with the SMTP password.
fields.summary: Don't store the SMTP Server password in clear text

fields.description:
Crowd is sending the following emails to the Adminsitrator

{noformat}
Dear Administrator,

You are fast approaching (within 10%) the user limit of your current crowd license (License Limit: 500 Current Users: 468).

Please be aware that Crowd will no longer function when you have reached your user limit.

Best Regards,

The Crowd Team.
{noformat}
{noformat}

Dear Administrator,

You are fast approaching (within 10%) the user limit of your current crowd license (License Limit: 500 Current Users: 801).

Please be aware that Crowd will no longer function when you have reached your user limit.

Best Regards,

The Crowd Team.
{noformat}

The first email is correct, however the second has the wrong count result and Crowd allows discrepant values to be sent to the Admin *(License Limit: 500 Current Users: 801)*.

Recalculating the number of users again (Admin -> License), displays the correct number and even with the wrong count, looks like crowd Console is not being locked.
fields.summary: For the same instance, Crowd calculates different numbers of active users at different times.

fields.description:
Mirror SVN authentication system fucntionality for git.

May be able to adapt the existing Crowd module and simply do a doc writeup.

http://maymay.net/blog/2008/08/08/how-to-use-http-basic-authentication-with-git/
fields.summary: git authentication

fields.description:
Crowd should detect if the Integration Client jar *exists*, *has the correct version* and *is not duplicated*. 

The _Integration Status_ would be displayed for each integrated application separately (Applications tab), and would be also available in the System Info page.
fields.summary: Crowd should detect if the Integration Client exists, has the correct version and is not duplicated.
Prevent deletion of the last directory associated with Crowd Console

fields.description:
For SMTP Servers that require authentication, Crowd will error out with the following error:

Caused by: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPAddressFailedException: 553 sorry, that domain isn't allowed to be relayed thru this MTA (#5.7.1) (XXXXXX, smtpauth: no)

A workaround is to configure a [JNDI|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Configuring+your+Mail+Server#ConfiguringyourMailServer-MailServerOption2%3AJNDILocation] connection.
fields.summary: SMTP Authentication not working

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be nice to have an extra field in the user attributes to indicate when a user was created. 
We often have to find out who/when authorized a user's access. To do this, I need to run a lengthy query on our helpdesk system.
A simple postgres query gives me this information, but that's a little inconvenient. Here's the query:

crowddb=> select "CONCEPTION" from "REMOTEPRINCIPAL" where "NAME" = 'foobar';
       CONCEPTION
-------------------------
 2008-03-09 15:38:40.623
(1 row)

It would also be nice if the time fields were in human readable format.

Thanks
John Ryan
fields.summary: Add "conception" field to User Attributes

fields.description:
The warning message " You have provided an XML backup of crowd that did not contain specific Crowd Console information, this has resulted in the Crowd application password being reset in crowd.properties."

Is being displayed if an InvalidAuthorizationTokenException is thrown on the Complete screen when trying to authenticate the console. There are more reasons why this could be thrown that the message given. We should log why and double check that the reason is actually valid.
fields.summary: Warning message "You have provided an XML backup of crowd that did not contain specific Crowd Console information..." is being displayed incorrectly on the Setup's Complete screen.

fields.description:
Add an overview page about case sensitivity in Crowd. Link to it from the relevant directory, caching and application pages.

See also the new page on "Enforcing Lower-Case Usernames, Groups and Roles for an Application":
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Enforcing+Lower-Case+Usernames%2C+Groups+and+Roles+for+an+Application

In the overview page, cover the challenges and how Crowd solves them:
* LDAP directories for the most part perform case-insensitive matches, but preserve case when passing information back to the requester.
* Applications behave in different ways. Some, like JIRA and Confluence, insist on lower-case usernames.
* Crowd: internal directories; LDAP directory caches; application caches
See words in:
** Client caches CWD-1395 and CWD-1252
** Directory cache CWD-1394
** Internal directory CWD-1396
fields.summary: Add an overview page on case sensitivity in Crowd
Please check case sensitivity in various searches on Admin Console
Add help link to help-paths.properties for new application tab

fields.description: When an admin views a user that has exceeded their maximum number of password attempts, it would be good to display a banner to warn the admin that the user won't be able to log in until their password is reset.
fields.summary: Display warning in UI for administrators viewing principals that have exceeded their maximum password attempts

fields.description:
In Crowd 1.6.1 we have a new "Optional" tab for applications. Currently, it contains only the new "Lower Case" checkbox. 

Some suggestions about the text/UI:
* It would be nice if we can use the existing "Configuration" tab (Google Apps only at the moment) instead of an "Optional" tab. But this is problematic, because the "Configuration" tab is generated by the plugin.
* Otherwise, can we change the new tab name from "Optional" to "Options" so that it matches the other tabs (all nouns)?
fields.summary: UI text in Crowd 1.6.1

fields.description: Attempts to read DN data from {{memberUid}}, which fails because the {{memberUid}} contains the {{uid}} (username).
fields.summary: findGroupRelationships() is broken for Posix directories

fields.description: The drop-down does not appear; it should.
fields.summary: Directory Encryption Type is not available for generic Posix or OpenLDAP Posix directories

fields.description:
The component plugin module documentation has been reported to error out with Crowd 1.5 (but 1.6 works):

{code}
2009-01-29 16:28:41,983 main ERROR [atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser] There were problems loading the module 'component' in plugin 'Palm x Manager Plugin'. The module has been disabled.
2009-01-29 16:28:41,985 main ERROR [atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser] Cannot find ModuleDescriptor class for plugin of type 'component'.
com.atlassian.plugin.PluginParseException: Cannot find ModuleDescriptor class for plugin of type 'component'.
at com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.descriptors.CrowdModuleDescriptorFactory.getModuleDescriptor(CrowdModuleDescriptorFactory.java:32)
at com.atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser.createModuleDescriptor(XmlDescriptorParser.java:129)
at com.atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser.configurePlugin(XmlDescriptorParser.java:90)
at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.SinglePluginLoader.loadPlugin(SinglePluginLoader.java:81)
at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.SinglePluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(SinglePluginLoader.java:47)
at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ClassPathPluginLoader.loadClassPathPlugins(ClassPathPluginLoader.java:53)
at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ClassPathPluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(ClassPathPluginLoader.java:70)
at com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager.init(DefaultPluginManager.java:95)
etc.
{code}

Reference: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=31671&tstart=0
fields.summary: Component Plugin Modules development documentation needs review

fields.description:
The Crowd Directories (Crowd console -> Directories) can't be listed if at least one of them is off-line.

See log messages *attached*.

After a timeout, the list is displayed.
fields.summary: Directories can't be listed if they are off-line

fields.description:
Allow users to be added to many Groups when inserted by an Integrated Application

Example:

When having Confluence and Jira integrated with Crowd, when a new user is created using Confluence, it will be added to the *confluence-users* group only.

Would be great to be able to specify more groups to add the new user, so that they would be able to login in other integrated applications (like Jira). Having the user also added to jira-users would save the admin time.
fields.summary: Allow users to be added to many Groups when inserted by an Integrated Application

fields.description:
Currently addAllUsers and addAllGroups on the DirectoryManager will not fire any UserCreatedEvents or GroupCreatedEvents. This was specifically disabled for performance reasons.

We need to benchmark the impact of firing these events, especially within the context of the AutoGroupAdderListener that specifically listens to these events. If the performance issues are manageable, then we should fire these events for bulk operations.

This affects all importers including the CSV importer and the directory importer.
fields.summary: Fire user/group created events for user bulk add operations

fields.description:
Currently the searchPrincipals and findAll* call return all results in one go.  JIRA/OSUser uses these to implement getAllUsers.  This puts a huge load on the underlying directories, the crowd server and client (due to the marshalling/demarshalling of the messages) and the network; on the Atlassian internal directory the returned request is 5MB+ (see JRA-16131).

Ideally there should be paged versions of these calls, and the Crowd connector should be modified to use them.
fields.summary: Add paged version of searchPrincipals and findAll* API calls

fields.description: We would like to specify the full subject line when we send an email to reset a user's password.  Currently we don't have any choice but to have "Reset Password" tacked onto the subject.
fields.summary: When resetting a user's password, we would like to specify the full email subject

fields.description: Provide a link on the Crowd Console login screen to send the username of a principal to a given email address, provided there exists a principal with that email address.
fields.summary: Username Reminder Tool
